description:
Hi. This is a loop of Aurora Colorado's
old Whelen WPS-3016 system test. The city had 3016's, and WPS-2810's. They did the WAIL tone for 3 minutes, and the WHOOP tone for 30 seconds. This is a one sycle loop of the WAIL tone. You can hear the other sirens in the system in the background, as well as some very excited dogs that where barking during the whole test. I don't know the exact location of this siren. Also, the system has been removed and replaced with new whelens a couple of years ago. They had a yellow WPS-3016 in the sistem Hope you like it. I'll get a loop of the WHOOP tone soon. If you download this, or any of my other sounds for that matter, and use it in your production or any other thing, then please give me good credit. Thanks, and good bye.

name: Sirens Cyprus 2017.mp3
description:
This is the sound of the sirens as we could hear them on the 20th of July at 5:30 in the morning.

It was 20th of July 1974, and the time was 5:30 when the Turkish invasion started in Cyprus, and every year the sirens go off to remind us of this event.

Also every 15th of July at 8:20 in the morning the sirens also go off to remind us to the coup against the president of Cyprus Makarios which was the main reason that lead to the invasion after 5 days.

Apart from the sirens you can hear roosters, a chicken a collared dove and some traffic.
Recorded with my nexus5 mobile phone.

name: Nationwide Emergency Siren Test Germany Warntag 2020
description:
A Zoom H1n in Hoerstein (Germany) at 200m facing east over a very lage valley towards Frankfurt am Main, medium winds from the North. Directly ahead, in 5 km distance the village of Karlstein am Main, about 10 km to the right the Village of Alzenau, to the left in 20km distance the city of Aschaffenburg.
Sunny day with little to no clouds. On a flat hilltop with dry weeds.

This is the Recording of the Emergency Alert System Test (Warntag) in Germany on September 10, 2020 at 11:00 CET. 

Two or three steps of mine are heard just when the sirens start, i apologise. The H1n did pretty well for this very large and distant ambience, also 3 minutes ago two adults with very loud children passed through and almost ruined the recording.

Next time i'll be better prepared (in one year, that is), and hopefully the german emergency system will be, too (press is reporting of a failure).

To my surprise, there was no all-clear signal, which i waited for, for 20 minutes.

name: TAKHALLOUFT_Farrah_2017_2018_POLICE-SIREN.wav
description:
It's a synthetised police siren. You can use it for a video, or a game for exemple. 

I used audacity to make it. 

To make it there is the different steps

-	DTMF Tones carré fréquence 150 amplitude 0,8 (DTMF Tones square frequency 150 amplitude 0.8)
-	Chirp Sinusoide fréquence début 460 fin 1300 amplitude début 0,8 fin 0,1 interpolation linéaire (Chirp Sinusoid frequency beginning 460 end 1300 amplitude beginning 0.8 end 0.1 linear interpolation)
-	Dupliquer (duplicate)
-	Inverser sens (Reverse direction)
-	Normaliser( Normalize)
-	Mixage et rendu (Mixing and rendering)
-	Fondu d’ouverture ( Fade out openning)
-	Fondu fermeture ( Fade out closing)
-	Répéter le son x3 (repeat the sound x3)


I hope you'll like it don't hesitate to download.

name: Seventh Chord Siren Mono
description:
This synthesized siren is based on a seventh chord of 4 notes constructed using frequency ratios. The second note is 5/4 the pitch of the first note, the third note is 6/5 the pitch of the second note, and the fourth note is 5/4 the pitch of the third note.

Each note has a different pitch graph applied to it. The graphs are:
1st note: power of 2 (ie Square)
2nd note: cube root
3rd note: geometric sequence with common ratio of 0.5
4th note: square root

This sound is effectively mono, i.e. the left and right channels are identical.

This sound has been created using the Kangas Sound Editor, an open-source/freeware program available from multiple download sites on the Internet.

Recorded with an iphone xs and the just press record application.

name: COVINI_Jessica_2017_2018_Tsunami.wav
description:
Tsunami in Japan was created with a mix of recorded songs and also the creation of several tracks. 

First I generated 3 differents noises (I changed the height of the first one by reducing 2 times 30 half tons, I increased the height at the end for the second one and reduced a little the height of the third noise). I finished by adding reverb (60%) used "Wah Wah" effect and fade out. By doing this, I got the saturation that I wanted, creating the impression of the sound of a real tsunami.

After I used registered songs of seagulls, waves and sirens. I added reverb (39%) for all of my tracks and repeated the song of the siren 3 times. I also used the effect "normalisation" and used the effect "noise decrease" and fade in. I wanted that when the tsunami arrives, the sound looks like an explosion.
Description: Everything was perfect and quiet in this small island of Japan, the beach, the sound of the seagulls ... when suddenly we can hear the trembling sound of sirens. Yes, the tsunami is here, ready to destroy everything.

---

Descriptif selon la typologie de Schaeffer :
Typologie : continu complexe (X) 
Masse : Groupe nodal avec sons complexes)
Timbre harmonique : acide, doux, puis granuleux et terne 
Grain : Le son est plutôt lisse au départ puis rugueux à la fin
Allure : Pas de vibrato
Dynamique : Attaque douce et graduelle  
Profil mélodique : Variation serpentine
Profil de masse : Site pour le son d'ambiance, qui apporte plus de profondeur. Calibre : pour l'équalisation utilisée pour nettoyer les fréquences perturbatrices (sons indésirables) et mettre en avant les éléments voulus.

name: Facility Siren (Loopable)
description: I got a weird story for this one! I took a machine sound from my grandpa's workshop, overloaded it with flanger so it didn't even sound like a machine anymore, got a little snippet of the sound, pitch shifted it up, and repeated it, EQed it, and added some reverb. (The machine didn't have anything do do with it btw. You can do this with any sound.) Hope you guys enjoy this sound. Feel free to use this anywhere you want. :)

name: VALENTIN_Hugo_2020-2021_SpaceNoise.wav
description:
This sound was fully created with Audacity. 
First, I generated a white noise (with 0,3 of amplitude). Then, I applied a phaser effect to obtain a back and forth movement. I was really happy with this, but I wanted it to be more distinct, that’s why I used the graphic equalizer : boosting treble frequencies, and lowering basses frequencies. The trac kwas long enough, so I chose a few parts and cut out the rest.
 
After all these modifications, the sound was too strong, thus I normalized my track (with the recommended settings) and got something more enjoyable. However, the saturation-like result was not exactly what I was looking for. In order to increase this back and forth movement while reducing the saturation, I applied a wah-wah effect, which resulted on the sound you’re listening to. I just added a repetition to make it last a litte longer. 

It was really fun to create. Trying different things, cancelling effects, adjusting measures … and finally get the sound you were looking for.

description:
I made it just because I made it... A little smoother than the others, you could like it if you didn't enjoyed the others.

This one could be better if you edit it to your scenario, because I know, it's not really a siren... :)

----------

This sound made with LMMS is good for short movies.

I hope you to enjoy this, if you need some variant I can make it for you, just ask me.

And DO NOT FORGET TO GIVE CREDITS, I'll appreciate that, thank you.

---------- TECHNICAL ----------

Common:
- Duration: 1 sec 718 ms
- Producer: Xiph.Org libVorbis I 20150105
- MIME type: audio/vorbis
- Endianness: Little endian

name: ob12-growling-wailing-sirene.flac
description: More advanced wailing siren than the Juno 106 one: while the LFO modulates pitch upwards, it negatively modulates pulse width. name: Siren Test & Howling Dog April 6 2016.mp3
description: Monthly siren test in Atchison Kansas recorded out my bedroom window facing east to the back yard. Recorded with Lifecam HD3000. You hear a bit of traffic in the beginning, then 3 sirens, 2 background, one foreground. A neighbor's dog sings counterpoint. You can hear a common grackle as well at times. The sirens wind down and a bluejay starts up calling as the dog continues to howl. The test went on for over 3 minutes, a bit unusual that. Searching Google I found that some time ago Atchison got new 2001's and Eclipses to replace their old Thunderbolts and 2t22's. Maybe a siren expert will leave a comment and let us know which ones we heard.

name: Siren Alarm Test - Far

Recorded with Zoom H6 and XYH6 capsule, edited in Reaper.

name: FIADONOU_Israella_2020_2021_SIRENE.wav
description:
I tried to make the sound of a fireman's siren. 
For this, I opted for a hybrid sound with a voice-over recording and a "sawtooth" tone of 494 Hz to represent the note "B" and 440 Hz to represent the note "A". 
This is a mix of 2 tracks to obtain a 9.6 second sound, almost identical to a fireman's siren. 
We had to play with the level tool (envelope) to manage the inputs and outputs of the sound.

name: Cincinnati Thunderbolts Synth
description:
This is a Synth of 3 Federal Thunderbolts set up in Downtown Cincinnati, OH. There is the 4/5 Broken Rotator 1000T on the Federal Building, the 5/6 Broken Rotator 1000T on the YMCA Building, and the 8 RPM 1000 on the Park & Lytle Place Building. The SPCA 2 RPM 1000 can't be heard in this Synth. This Synth uses the NEW Frequency Sweep Plug-In created by guitarguy19852, i also messed around for HOURS with Reverb, i think this is the closest i can get. Feel free to request a Synth!

-Siren Boy
-MSS & More Team

name: ATI Viper 3200's

-Siren Boy
-MSS & More Team

name: LANCELLE_Leo_2021_22_Distorted siren.wav
description:
Here, I generated two different sounds:
A square-shaped sound lasting 1 second on a frequency of 440 to 1300 decibels.
A sawtooth shaped sound lasting 1 second on a frequency of 440 to 1300 decibels.

Then I synchronized the 2 sounds together, then I simply repeated and reversed the 2 sounds to give this impression of an alarm, or a police/fire siren.

Finally, to avoid saturation of the final sound, I normalized the pitch of the 2 sounds to -9 decibels.

name: Parisian fire truck siren
description:
A Parisian fire truck passes about 150 feet away and briefly turns on its siren to make sure nobody overlooks it.

Emergency vehicles in France have either two-tone or three-tone sirens. Vehicles to which one must yield the right of way, such as fire trucks, use the two-tone siren. The three-tone siren (not on this recording) is used for vehicles that do not require drivers to yield but should still be given some priority.

Recorded with a Zoom H4n hand-held, stereo 96 kHz / 24 bits, built-in mics, about 150 feet away from the passing truck

For this sound, I chosed to create a police siren sound. So I chosed to generate a tweet and I chose a square waveform. I chose a frequency increasing from 440 Hz to 1320 Hz. As I wanted a repetitive sound, I chose that my square wave should be short to be able to repeat it dynamically (3 seconds). Finally, once my wave is over, I simply create a repetition of it.

Description - Typologie de Schaeffer

Masse : Son cannelé  
Timbre: Acide
 Grain : Son lisse
 Allure : Pas de vibrato 
Dynamique : Début du son assez violent, le son en lui-même est graduel
 Profil mélodique: Variation serpentine

name: Alien Siren
description:
An atmospheric alien like siren sound I made in FL Studio 20 using Sytrus. I made it mainly to practice and experiment with Sytrus. The sound itself was made using 5 of the 6 operators, the 3 filters and the reverb and chorus effect that are built-in Sytrus. All of the operators and the 3 filters are connected in some way to the X and Y modulation knobs. I then added a full rack of FX on the mixer like reverb, Maximus, Vocodex, Chorus, Etc... I also connected another rack of FX because the first one was full. I automated a bunch more stuff and this is basically the final result. Most of the FX on the racks are actually very subtle, it's just that there are a lot of them. 

You may use this sound for your own project as long as you give credit.

If you ever do use this and post something online like a video, a music piece or anything else that contains it, I would be very interested in hearing/seeing it if you don't mind :)

name: CRUMIERE_Robin_2019_2020_FiretruckSiren.wav
description: This sound was made on Audacity. I generated a chirp going from 440 Hz (amplitude 0.8) to 1320 Hz (amplitude 0.1). I copied-pasted the sound a few times to have something which sounds like kind of a siren. I reduced the volume by 6dB and reversed the direction of the copied-pasted sounds. Then, I used the cut function and the fade-in and fade-out effects to erase the « crack noises » and to obtain a smooth transition when the siren goes up or down. I finally added a reverb effect to feel like the siren is heard from an empty street.
